meta.name: Automate Feature Request Collection & Analysis from Reviews to Jira with AI

parameters.text:
=Extract review text, title, date and username (if any) from the following url. Make sure to extract only those reviews that are asking for functionality for better user experiance.

URL: {{ $json.URL }}

nodes.name: ğŸ—‚ï¸ Create Feature Ticket in Jira

parameters.content:
## ğŸ§© **Section 1: Start and Target Setup**

ğŸ“¦ **Nodes Combined**:

* `ğŸ”˜ Start Manual Execution`
* `ğŸ–Šï¸ Edit Target Site URL`

### ğŸ” What Happens Here:

This section is where your workflow **begins** and gets the **input URL** of the review site.

* âœ… **Manual Trigger**:
  Allows you to run this workflow by clicking â€œExecute Workflow.â€ Great for testing new URLs.

* âœï¸ **Edit Field**:
  You input the **URL of the review page**, such as:

  * `https://www.g2.com/products/clickup/reviews`
  * `https://www.trustpilot.com/review/clickup.com`

### ğŸ’¡ Beginner Tip:

Instead of hardcoding URLs in code, this editable field makes it easy for **non-developers** to change input by just typing/pasting the review page.

---

## ğŸ¤– **Section 2: Scrape and Structure User Reviews**

ğŸ› ï¸ **Core Nodes**:

* `ğŸ¤– Scrape Reviews using Agent`
* `ğŸŒ Bright Data MCP Scraper`
* `ğŸ§  OpenAI Chat Model (Optional)`
* `ğŸ§¾ Parse Structured Agent Output`

### ğŸ” What Happens Here:

This section uses **AI + Bright Data** to fetch review content, extract important insights, and prepare structured output.

* ğŸŒ **Agent Node**:
  Launches your custom scraper (via Bright Data MCP) to visit the site and collect reviews.

* ğŸ§¾ **Output Parser**:
  Cleans up the output to return just the **structured review objects** like:

  ```json
  {
    "title": "...",
    "username": "...",
    "review_text": "...",
    "date": "..."
  }
  ```

* ğŸ§  **(Optional AI Model)**:
  If used, this can:

  * Classify reviews into categories (e.g., UI issue, billing issue)
  * Summarize long reviews
  * Extract common themes or keywords

### ğŸ’¡ Beginner Tip:

This is where the **heavy lifting happens** â€” the agent goes out and scrapes the content **so you donâ€™t have to copy-paste reviews manually.**

---

## ğŸ§¾ **Section 3: Convert Reviews into Jira Tasks**

ğŸ§© **Final Nodes**:

* `ğŸ§© Format Individual Reviews` (Function Node)
* `ğŸ—‚ï¸ Create Feature Ticket in Jira`

### ğŸ” What Happens Here:

Each review gets **processed and pushed to Jira** as an individual ticket so your product team can track it.

* ğŸ”„ **Split Function Node**:
  Takes the list of 5+ reviews returned by the agent and **splits them one by one** so Jira receives **a single review per ticket**.

* ğŸ“‹ **Jira Node**:
  Sends the review content to **Jira Software**, creating a ticket like:

  * **Summary**: `"Feature Request: Better Dashboard Customization"`
  * **Description**: `"James (Jul 24, 2024): 'It would be nice to see a simplified home screen and personalized dashboards.'"`
  * **Priority**: Can be assigned based on keyword frequency or sentiment.

### ğŸ’¡ Beginner Tip:

Youâ€™re now **automatically turning feedback into action**, saving hours of reading and logging manually into Jira.

---

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# **ğŸ“¥ Gather & Prioritize Feature Requests into Jira (Trustpilot)**

## ğŸ¤– **Section 2: Scrape and Structure User Reviews**

### ğŸ” What Happens Here:

This section uses **AI + Bright Data** to fetch review content, extract important insights, and prepare structured output.

* ğŸŒ **Agent Node**:
  Launches your custom scraper (via Bright Data MCP) to visit the site and collect reviews.

* ğŸ§¾ **Output Parser**:
  Cleans up the output to return just the **structured review objects** like:

  ```json
  {
    "title": "...",
    "username": "...",
    "review_text": "...",
    "date": "..."
  }
  ```

* ğŸ§  **(Optional AI Model)**:

  * Classify reviews into categories (e.g., UI issue, billing issue)
  * Summarize long reviews

### ğŸ’¡ Beginner Tip:

## ğŸ§¾ **Section 3: Convert Reviews into Jira Tasks**

ğŸ§© **Final Nodes**:

* `ğŸ§© Format Individual Reviews` (Function Node)
* `ğŸ—‚ï¸ Create Feature Ticket in Jira`

### ğŸ” What Happens Here:

Each review gets **processed and pushed to Jira** as an individual ticket so your product team can track it.

* ğŸ”„ **Split Function Node**:
  Takes the list of 5+ reviews returned by the agent and **splits them one by one** so Jira receives **a single review per ticket**.

* ğŸ“‹ **Jira Node**:
  Sends the review content to **Jira Software**, creating a ticket like:

  * **Description**: `"James (Jul 24, 2024): 'It would be nice to see a simplified home screen and personalized dashboards.'"`
  * **Priority**: Can be assigned based on keyword frequency or sentiment.

### ğŸ’¡ Beginner Tip:

Youâ€™re now **automatically turning feedback into action**, saving hours of reading and logging manually into Jira.

## âœ… Why This Workflow is Powerful:

| Benefit                       | Description                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| â±ï¸ **Time-Saving**            | No need to copy/paste from reviews â€” everything is automated.        |

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[
  {
    "title": "Accessed blocked if you don't give in to their relentless demands for more money",
    "url": "https://www.trustpilot.com/reviews/68545e853e1c35a6c56f3cdf",
    "date": "2025-06-19",
    "username": "Sam Rimmer",
    "review_text": "Useful but limited during the free trial period, as soon as I paid it got worse and all I get now is messages saying I am being charged more for using a feature that wasn't kicked and appeared free. They are trying to charge me 4 times what I agreed to."
  },
  {
    "title": "Sneaky thievery",
    "url": "https://www.trustpilot.com/reviews/6853a8b8f4a7682e23040c20",
    "date": "2025-06-19",
    "username": "Marisa Taylor",
    "review_text": "I was very excited to join ClickUp due to its features and the supposed flexibility. The package I bought was supposedly for 15 users. Long story short, when members were added to the package it was not made clear that additional seats would be automatically debited from my account - without warning."
  },
  {
    "title": "Misleading Storage Limits, Buggy System, and Clueless Support",
    "url": "https://www.trustpilot.com/reviews/684add985445fa4b95152b78",
    "date": "2025-06-12",
    "username": "Dovid Kaleky",
    "review_text": "ClickUp talks a big game, but the actual experience is frustrating and unreliable. Hereâ€™s the real issue: The system claims Iâ€™ve used 80MB of file space, but I only have about 1MB of actual files. I even deleted a bunch... but despite being well under the supposed limit, ClickUp still acts like Iâ€™m maxed out."
  },
  {
    "title": "Is it theft? ClickUp's \"downgrade\" money-taking",
    "url": "https://www.trustpilot.com/reviews/682a3f93cc1817e84578bfb5",
    "date": "2025-05-18",
    "username": "CMJP",
    "review_text": "ClickUp's \"downgrade\" policy looks very much like theft. As soon as you disable recurrent billing for an 'annual' plan, you lose all the time you prepaid for."
  },
  {
    "title": "Lots of functionality, not intuitive",
    "url": "https://www.trustpilot.com/reviews/67fd967ce994c1648b704ffe",
    "date": "2025-04-15",
    "username": "James",
    "review_text": "Looks like there is a lot of functionality here, but I find the user experience to be a bit clunky. It would be nice to see a simplified home screen and much more personalized dashboards."
  }
]
